summary: Opossums are marsupials found in the Americas, with 126 species in 18 genera. They originated in South America and spread north during the Great American Interchange. The Virginia opossum is the only species in the U.S. and Canada, often called a "possum." Though similar in appearance, Australasian possums are not related. Opossums are usually non-aggressive and rarely carry rabies.
title: Opossum
